page.title: 16WORK AND UNEMPLOYMENT
page.content: Many years ago people had to dig by hand. The transportation of goods was also done by man power. Today modern machinery has taken over these jobs creating unemployment in the area in which we live. Some of the many jobs which are left to do are things like building houses, selling clothes and food,working in an office for a business or teaching in schools. There are some factories in our area e.g. Heanor Gate industrial estate and Morleys but there are still not enough jobs to go around everybody, and 14% are unemployed. The opencast employs many workers however, though this is also declining. Now the people in our are have three choices, either: 1. Go on for further education, 2. Keep trying to get a job, or 3. Sign on social security.
